thread.section_title: Live Feed Wire - Golf News Today - EIN Presswire

author: courier-journal.com
text:
Business Economy News News Based on facts, either observed and verified directly by the reporter, or reported and verified from knowledgeable sources. Economy | ‘Trouble on the horizon’: Pleasanton begins tough budget discussions with new council Here’s what $8.85 million in cuts could look like Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) Click to print (Opens in new window) Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Click to share on Reddit (Opens in new window) A drone view of Main Street in downtown Pleasanton, Calif., on Tuesday, Nov. 12, 2024. (Jane Tyska/Bay Area News Group) By Kyle Martin | kymartin@bayareanewsgroup.com | Bay Area News Group PUBLISHED: December 17, 2024 at 6:15 AM PST The City Council will begin discussing what the next two fiscal years will look like as it weighs cutting over $8 million in services to stave off an expected $13 million to $22 million annual shortfall.
